page.title: 17Employment
page.content: Beaconsfield is a non-industrial town. Surveys show that about 25% of working people here commute to London.Local industries are:WIGGINS TEAPE , the third largest paper company in the U.K. It has 200 staff concerned with research into paper making, with a large annual expenditure.PERKIN ELMER with H.Q.here, makes scientific analytical instruments and employs 593 people.WAITROSE is the largest local supermarket employing about 150 people.Other shops vary in size and employ about 200 people.WILTON PARK,the army education centre,has a shifting labour force.BEACONSFIELD FILM STUDIOS make educational films and train students in the art of film making.THE TOWN COUNCIL employs people for collection of rubbish,and car parking fees, together with other services to the community.
